gobblin.writer.http

Interface HttpWriterDecoration<D>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractHttpWriter, HttpWriterDecorator

    public interface HttpWriterDecoration<D>
    Defines the main extension points for the AbstractHttpWriter.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.apache.http.HttpHost chooseServerHost()
      An extension point to select the HTTP server to connect to.
      void onConnect(org.apache.http.HttpHost serverHost)
      A callback triggered before attempting to connect to a new host.
      com.google.common.base.Optional<org.apache.http.client.methods.HttpUriRequest> onNewRecord(D record, com.google.common.base.Optional<org.apache.http.client.methods.HttpUriRequest> request)
      A callback that allows the subclasses to customize the construction of an HTTP request based on incoming records.
      void processResponse(org.apache.http.HttpResponse response)
      Processes the response

    • Method Detail

      • chooseServerHost

        org.apache.http.HttpHost chooseServerHost()
        An extension point to select the HTTP server to connect to.

      • onConnect

        void onConnect(org.apache.http.HttpHost serverHost)
        throws IOException
        A callback triggered before attempting to connect to a new host. Subclasses can override this method to customize the connect logic. For example, they can implement OAuth authentication.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • onNewRecord

        com.google.common.base.Optional<org.apache.http.client.methods.HttpUriRequest> onNewRecord(D record,
                                                                                           com.google.common.base.Optional<org.apache.http.client.methods.HttpUriRequest> request)
        A callback that allows the subclasses to customize the construction of an HTTP request based on incoming records. Customization may include, setting the URL, headers, buffering, etc.
        Parameters:
        record - the new record to be written
        request - the current request object; if absent the implementation is responsible of allocating a new object
        Returns:
        the current request object; if absent no further processing will happen

      • sendRequest

        com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<org.apache.http.HttpResponse> sendRequest(org.apache.http.client.methods.HttpUriRequest request)
                                                                                      throws IOException
        An extension point to send the actual request to the remote server.
        Parameters:
        request - the request to be sent
        Returns:
        a future that allows access to the response. Response may be retrieved synchronously or asynchronously.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • waitForResponse

        void waitForResponse(com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<org.apache.http.HttpResponse> responseFuture)
        Customize the waiting for an HTTP response. Can add timeout logic.
        Parameters:
        responseFuture - the future object of the last sent request

      • processResponse

        void processResponse(org.apache.http.HttpResponse response)
              throws IOException,
                     UnexpectedResponseException
        Processes the response
        Throws:
        IOException - if there was a problem reading the response
        UnexpectedResponseException - if the response was unexpected
